page.title: 07R.A.F. STANBRIDGE
page.content: The R.A.F. base is situated on Stanbridge Road at the South East end of Leighton Buzzard. It was opened as a communication base. During the Second World War it was a major base for secret communication traffic. During this time it was greatly extended and many underground passages were built and filled with modern equipment. The equipment has become out moded. This has caused the present run-down of the base with only a few personel and key workers left. Much of the R.A.F. housing lies empty. The future of the base is at present very uncertain. Many plans have been discussed including use of the base as a transit camp or closing the base completely. No decision has yet been taken.
